document_data.name: Vandal Station
document_data.mainbody: '''Vandal Station''' was a [[Rengarth]] town during the time of ancient [[Netheril]].
document_data.Geography: The settlement was built on the coast of the [[Narrow Sea]], between [[Bandor]] and [[Northreach]].
document_data.Trade: Vandal Station traded heavily with nearby Bandor Village, buying the [[silver]] and [[gold]] mined there.
document_data.History:
Vandal Station was founded in {{yearlinkConvert|723|NY}} by the [[Vandals]] tribe of Rengarths, who fiercely protected the area as far away as the [[Cold Forest]]. During the following [[Silver Age]], the [[Netherese]] took up aggressive mining expeditions in the [[Barren Mountains]], coming into conflict with the Vandals as they passed. This came to a head in {{yearlinkConvert|1412|NY}} when the Vandals killed an entire group of miners and their guards who had been digging up their sacred burial grounds in search for gold and silver.

A plague from Bandor Village struck in {{yearlinkConvert|2328|NY}}, sweeping through the population and reducing it from 4500 to fewer than 500 souls. Unable to protect their ancestral lands, most of the survivors moved to distant [[Frostypaw]], while the few who remained patrolled the land in small groups in an attempt to protect their most important sites.

Vandal Station ceased even being a village in {{yearlinkConvert|2784|NY}}, with just a few scattered holdouts residing in the area. The ruins of the city became covered in a sheet of lethally cold ice, and in the spring of {{yearlinkConvert|3353|NY}} wolves descended upon the site and took the last Vandal bodies, fully removing Vandal Station from history.
